ul.li:
Include these codes as defined in http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/DT
CodeDisplayDefinition
Birth dose administration as part of bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV) plus inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) schedule (in countries that are poliomyelitis (polio)-endemic countries or at high risk of importation and subsequent spread of polio that follow the combined bOPV窶的PV schedule)Birth dose administration as part of "bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV) plus inactivated polio vaccine (IPV)" schedule (in countries that are poliomyelitis (polio)-endemic countries or at high risk of importation and subsequent spread of polio that follow the combined bOPV窶的PV schedule)Birth dose administration as part of "bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV) plus inactivated polio vaccine (IPV)" schedule (in countries that are poliomyelitis (polio)-endemic countries or at high risk of importation and subsequent spread of polio that follow the combined bOPV窶的PV schedule)
Referenced in the following locations:
* Decision Tables: IMMZ.D2.DT.Polio.Birthdose
* Tabs: Polio

Should vaccinate client with bOPV birth dose (a zero dose) as poliovirus birth dose was not administered and clients age is less than 1 week. code.value: Birth dose administration as part of bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV) plus inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) schedule (in countries that are poliomyelitis (polio)-endemic countries or at high risk of importation and subsequent spread of polio that follow the combined bOPV窶的PV schedule)

bOPV birth dose (a zero dose) was not administered
Client is due for the bOPV birth dose
Should vaccinate client with bOPV birth dose (a zero dose) as poliovirus birth dose was not administered and clients age is less than 1 week. Check for contraindications.
